fields.description: It would be useful if JIRA Agile could email Agile Kanban boards (with issues in each column/status, perhaps also with swimlanes) much the same way that issue filters can be subscribed to. Being able to share the Kanban by generating a report in PDF would also be useful.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile Kanbans - Subscriptions & Sharing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11999].
  {panel}

On my Scrum or Kanban board I'm using the functionality to generate swim lanes using Epics.

It works for locally created epics but not for the one linked from an external project.
Swim lanes and tasks using external epic links  are not being displayed on the board at all... look at screenshot 1.

So basically the functionality is useless for us, as we want to store all the epics in a separate project for tractability purposes.

A similar issue is visible on the Scrum Backlog planning board - for all the externally linked epics the label is not generated - screenshoot 2.

It is related with https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-34243
fields.summary: Externally linked epics won't generate a swim lane

fields.description:
It would be beneficial to be able to view a report under a project that takes into consideration all epics or a selected list of epics within that project. The epic report feature only allows the viewing of one epic at a given time.

*Current behavior*
When selecting the Epic report under a project, you are forced to view one and only one Epic

*Requested behavior*
When selecting the Epic report under a project, you are given a choice of super-selecting multiple Epics within the project. The subsequent report output would display information based on all of these Epics. The following list of issues that were covered in each Epic would allow filtering / modifying of the datas output
fields.summary: Allow report of all epics within a single release

fields.description:
We have subtasks that need to be executed in a very particular order. The subtasks have been ordered correctly when looking at the parent issue, by using the up and down arrows. This does not seem to actually update their ranking though. 

When looking at the rapidboard view, the subtasks are not in the priority order they were put in under the parent issue. The board is ranking by rank. If I go back to the parent issue and use the gear to "rank to top" or "rank to bottom" then the order is updated on the rapidboard but not in the order on the parent issue.

The two are disconnected from one another. You would have to manually rank them twice, using each ranking UI individually. Meaning that you would first go in and rank them all in the Parent Issue view. And then rank all of the sub tasks again on the board. 

I would expect the behavior to function basically the way updating ranking works when filtering by Epic on a backlog. You can update the relative order in just that epic. Then when you clear the filter the order of other issues has not changed. Meaning that if I update the ranking of subtasks on a parent issue, that is changing their relative order. So when looking at the Agile board, other issues may be sprinkled between them but the relative changes are reflected.
fields.summary: Subtask ranking between board view and list in Parent issue disconnected

fields.description:
I want the ability to forecast work as its planned. 

Currently only active sprints and display on calendars.
After the scope of the project is defined i would like the ability to see the project on the calendars. 

I could start all the sprints to make them appear. but when a sprint end all open issues are added to the backlog instead of a the next sprint  

Suggestions 
a) add the ability to configure dates against planned sprints (preferred)  or 
b) add the option move incomplete issues to the next sprint
fields.summary: Forecasting Sprints  (Team calendars)

fields.description:
I want the ability to forecast work as its planned. 

Currently only active sprints and display on calendars.
After the scope of the project is defined i would like the ability to see the project on the calendars. 

I could start all the sprints to make them appear. but when a sprint end all open issues are added to the backlog instead of a the next sprint  

Suggestions 
a) add the ability to configure dates against planned sprints (preferred)  or 
b) add the option move incomplete issues to the next sprint
fields.summary: Forecasting Sprints  (Team calendars)

fields.description:
It would be great to be notified if the sprint field has a value before moving an issue.
This causes a lot of confusion, since the consequences of moving an issue which already belongs to a sprint are not very intuitive for end-users:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6850
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-8168

My recommendation would be to display a warning during the move operation (i.e. *Move Issue: Update Fields* screen) such as the one below, and also to allow users to edit that field before moving the issue:
{panel:title=Warning}
(!) One or more issues belong to a sprint. Moving these issues will affect the boards which include them prior to and after the move operation. For more details, please refer to the article [Same sprint displayed across different scrum boards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Same+sprint+displayed+across+different+scrum+boards].
{panel}
fields.summary: As a JIRA Agile user, I would like to be warned while moving issues which belong to a sprint

fields.description:
On the following documentation, its explained that the 'quick view' in JIRA Agile opens when clicking on the *key* of the issue.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+an+Issue
However, the quick view opens just by selecting a card with a left click.
This is annoying as we don't want to see the quick view all the time. Can this be fixed?
fields.summary: Quick view opens up when clicking anywhere on issue card

fields.description:
The documentation : [Viewing an Issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+an+Issue] mentions : 

bq. Click the issue key (or type t in the Active sprints/Kanban board) to display the Issue Detail View on the right-hand side of the screen.

However, the Issue Detail view opens up when you click anywhere on the card. Please update the documentation to reflect this.
fields.summary: Documentation for "Viewing an issue" needs to be fixed

fields.description:
At the moment, when adding a field from the issue view of an Agile Board I get redirected to the Custom Fields administration page in JIRA.

Whilst functional, as I can click "Add Field" from there, this is sub-optimal, as I lose my current working context (the Agile board + the issue in question) and it is inconsistent with the other issue views in JIRA (issue navigator split view, standalone view issue page).
fields.summary: As a user I would like to be able to add a field in-line from the issue view in the Agile Board

fields.description: My PO closed some stories after our I closed our current sprint, which moved the stories into the new sprint automatically.  I want to be able to edit the sprint in these stories to move them back to the previous sprint. Since I had created the new sprint, those stories remaining open in the previous sprint are now in the new sprint, which is incorrect.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master, I want the ability to move stories to a closed sprint.

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have a JIRA project with issues on it
# Have a Agile board related to this project
# Open the board and click on any issue
# Issue Detail View will open
# Click on the 3 dots gray button >> More Actions >> Add Field

*Expected Results:*
A window shows up for the user to choose which field to add.

*Actual Results:*
A not found message shows up.
!Screen Shot 2015-01-08 at 10.31.56 AM.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround:*
# Visit the board
# Click on Board gray button >> Configure >> Issue Detail View
# Add the desired field to it. 
Once it's configured, the field will appear on the issue view detail on the rapid board.
fields.summary: Add field from issue panel is not working from the Agile board

fields.description:
According to multiple sources on Scrum development, there are many accepted ways to define story points.

From [Scrum Methodology|http://scrummethodology.com/scrum-effort-estimation-and-story-points]
{quote}
Common estimating methods include t-shirt sizes (S, M, L, and too big), powers of 2 (1, 2, 4, 8), the Fibonacci sequence (1, 2, 3, 5, 8, etc.), or simply small vs. needs-to-be-split
{quote}

That leads to two suggestions:

*#1*
Additional methods of defining story points should be implemented in Agile, allowing Project Administrators to choose the best way to apply story points on their issues.

*#2*
There's no Scrum documentation referring to story points as decimal values, therefore JIRA accepts the input of such values.
fields.summary: Allow choice between types of Story Points

fields.description:
Currently there are a few documentations mentioning the Global Rank field as a new field in JIRA Agile.

It could cause some confusion to JIRA Agile users and Administrators, since the new Ranking Agile was introduced and the Global Rank and Classic boards are now deprecated.

It would be nice if the documentations that mention the Global Rank explains in which version it was introduced and which versions it became deprecated:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/The+Future+of+JIRA+Agile
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+6.4+Upgrade+Notes
fields.summary: Update Agile documentations regarding Global Rank field

fields.description:
Currently it is not possible to assign whole Epics to a version. It is possible to add all Stories of an Epic to a version using 'd&d' keyboard shortcut, but we still do not see Epics in a Version...

Because we usually release Features (Epics) and not individual Stories in a Version (production release) it is hard for us to track which features are in a version.
fields.summary: As Product Owner I want to assign Epics (with all its stories) to a Version

fields.description:
It is very useful to be able to create and add issues to versions via the plan wall in Jira Agile.  However, releasing, archiving, merging and deleting versions requires visiting a page that requires multiple-step navigation.  At the very least it would be an improvement to navigate to the  version administration page in one click, but it would be better (IMO) to have these commands available from the drop down that currently supports "Edit Name".

Thank you for your consideration.
fields.summary: Administer versions from Agile Plan wall

fields.description:
The "Send to" context in the right-click menu after selecting issues in the Backlog disappears if the user chooses to change the filter query from 'ORDER BY Rank ASC' to 'ORDER BY priority DESC'. 

This makes the ability to switch rather useless, we usually drag issues into sprints but could opt for right-clicking if the option was available, in order to sort by priority. (Super useful for organization and planning)

See image of how it is using the default filter query.
fields.summary: Right-click options to send issues to sprints disappear when not using ranking-based sorting

fields.description:
As a scrum master I often assign stories in the backlog to an epic via drag and drop. The epic panel in backlog mode shows up order by rank. This is correct since the board filter uses rank to allow reranking the stories in the backlog.

This is not the desired behavior for the epics in the side panel. Here an alphabetic order would be much more handy.

As a bonus it could be possible to assign a custom order to the panel via the board configuration.
fields.summary: Epic panel in Backlog mode

fields.description:
I frequently need to get a list of issues in a particular sprint, for example to export that list to excel to email the sprint contents to our extended team. 

Ideally I could just click on the "12 Issues" gray text underneath each sprint in the backlog view. 

Today this gray text is static text. Could it be converted into a hyperlink?
fields.summary: In backlog view, the Number of Issues listed below each Sprint should be a hyperlink

fields.description:
A sprint is expected to be [shared in multiple boards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Sprints+shared+between+multiple+boards], but the in-app messaging can be improved to avoid confusions in end user. 

For example, show the following message when completing a shared sprint.

"Completing this sprint will also complete the sprint in board A, B and C. Please refer to this KB article for more info: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Sprints+shared+between+multiple+boards"
fields.summary: Improve messaging on shared sprint

fields.description:
It would be nice to see percentiles in the Jira control chart.

Please see the attached image to get an idea of what I mean. These lines indicate that 75%/85%/95% of the tickets below where solved in X1, X2, X3 days (Just a quick sketch).

!controlchart_percent.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Percentiles in Jira control chart
Add time tracking on Epics to also summarize/calculate 'Issues in Epics' estimations

fields.description:
Currently, adding issues to an active sprint can be done by those who have 'Edit Issues' and 'Schedule Issues' permission for the projects included by the board's filter.

However, it would be better to restrict the action only to those who have 'Administer Project' permission. It makes more sense, because 1) Creating, 2) Starting, and 3) Finishing a Sprint can be done only by them.
fields.summary: Only those who have 'Administer Project' permission should be able to add issues to an active sprint

fields.description:
How to reproduce. 

Create a board with one project referenced. (You will see the project summary panel works as intended).

Create a board with more than one project referenced. (Board does not appear as there is more than one project)

Provide the option to access the project summary from the JIRA agile board view when multiple projects are referenced in the JIRA agile query.
fields.summary: Jira agile boards don't contain the Project summary panel if more than one project is referenced.

fields.description: In the new versions of JIRA Agile, when users visit a Rapid board, it displays "Kanban Board" or "Scrum board" on top of the page instead of the name of the board. In the older versions, the name of the board would show up at the top which was more helpful for a user.
fields.summary: Rapid board heading in the new UI is not very useful

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11966].
  {panel}

Customer is attempting to modify date format of date pickers in accordance with documentation located on an Atlassian Documentation site tailored to [Customizing the Look and Feel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Customizing+the+Look+and+Feel#CustomizingtheLookandFeel-Date/TimeFormats]. 

All Customer functions have been replicated in a test environment using Ubuntu Linux 14.04 VM, JIRA Server 6.3.15. Customer navigates to Administration > General Configuration > Advanced Settings. Next, the customer changes the default value of jira.date.picker.javascript.format and jira.date.picker.java.format (exhibit A).  Updates occur without incident.

Meanwhile, from the Agile menu, customer specifies a Kanban Board ("KanBoardAcme"). Under "Try the enhanced reports in JIRA Agile Lab", customer elects the "Enable" button (exhibit B). Scroll to the bottom of that page, and see the TimeScale area fail validation. Please see (exhibit C).

When the Advanced Setting sets these values, they are global, are they not? Therefore, the date-picker should use those settings to enforce its validation rules.
fields.summary: Enhanced Reports - Custom date fields within enhanced reports compel a user to use d/MMM/yy validation scheme

fields.description:
The version description on the planning board appears to be displayed in full without any truncation.  I got it up to about 45,000 characters in length via inline editing (at least 100 page-downs to see the whole thing) before it started getting really slow on JDOG and I got the timeout in the screenshot.  

It is very unlikely that anyone would want such a long description displayed in full.
fields.summary: Version description not truncated

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
* Create a user with permission to Administer Project, but no permission to create shared objects
* Navigate to:
** Agile Getting Started (http://<host>/secure/RapidStart.jspa)
** Navigate to Manage Boards (http://<host>/secure/ManageRapidViews.jspa)
fields.summary: Agile user without permission to create shared objects should not see "Create Board" buttons

fields.description:
It's possible to request a Version Report (and other reports) based on Versions that are explicitly ignored from the Board JQL. This shows a report with 'no issues', as they're explicitly ignored from the general filter.

*Example*
# Create a new Agile Project and board
** The filter will be similar to this {{project = "example" order by Rank Asc}}
# Create two versions
# Add an issue to each
# Edit the filter and exclude one of your versions {{project = "example" and fixVersion not in("Ignored Version") ORDER BY Rank ASC}}
# Go to Reports and look at the _Version Report_
# The 'Ignored Version' is still selectable, but always shows 0 issues.
fields.summary: Versions that are ignored from the Agile Board Filter should not appear as selectable in Reports

fields.description:
It is not possible to see a list of all boards connected to a JIRA project. Agile | Manage Boards show all boards in the system. 

But it is not a robust way because a board can be connected to several projects through it's filter, but only connected to e.g. one project, or none in this list. 

What I miss is a section under a project's Overview or Administration, where it could be nice to see all the boards that are connected to the specific project.
fields.summary: List all boards connected to a JIRA project

fields.description:
When I land on a board, the sidebar is minimsed. With the sidebar minimised I cannot see the board name. It is not apparent to a user that the board name may be displayed in the sidebar and this can lead to a feeling of being lost without knowing where to look.

There also appears to be a bug where board name comes into view for a split second when navigating from [Configure Board] page back to the Board. CSS bug???
fields.summary: BUG: No Board name when sidebar is minimised & CSS Bug?

fields.description:
I'm using the "Agile Days Remaining in Sprint", "Agile Sprint Health", "Agile Sprint Burndown" widgets on my dashboard

All are set to Sprint = "Next Sprint Due (auto)".
Auto refresh is ticked on "Agile Days Remaining in Sprint", "Agile Sprint Health"
Refresh interval is set to every 15 minutes on "Agile Sprint Burndown" 

But the "Agile Days Remaining in Sprint", "Agile Sprint Health" widgets aren't changing sprint automatically when one ends and another starts - I need to edit the dashboard and re-save the gadgets.

The "Agile Sprint Burndown" gadget is behaving as expected - the dashboard showed the new active sprint without requiring interaction from me.

Attached screenshot of my config for reference.
fields.summary: "Agile Days Remaining in Sprint" and "Agile Sprint Health" gadgets don't auto-switch sprints (but  "Agile Sprint Burndown" gadget does)
Inconsistent Behaviour When Sprint Started With A Future Start Date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This feature request is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11952].
  {panel}


1. Multiple agile boards are create for a existing projects.
2. When accessing project overview ( From top navigation menu: Project -> Select Project
3. It will display the last accessed board if the project has multiple boards.

It would be nice if there is an ability to configure a default board to be shown on the project overview per project.
fields.summary: Ability to configure a default board to show for a project

fields.description: If you copy an agile board with existing card layout settings these do not get copied over to the new board.
fields.summary: Copying a board does not copy the card layout settings

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Replicate
* Drag an issue from a status to another status. 

h3. Expected Result
Page refreshes and updates are shown correctly with the issue being shown under the status it is dropped in.

h3. Result
Page refreshes but updates are not properly shown. The dragged issue is still shown in the initial status and not under the status it is dropped in. When clicking on the specific ticket; can be seen from the ticket summary panel that the ticket is successfully transitioned. 

h3. Note
When checking on the Network analyzer; error 404 can be seen.

{noformat}
https://<le random instance>.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviewconfig/editmodel?rapidViewId=undefined&_=1428653295908
{noformat}
fields.summary: JIRA Agile board doesn't refresh and display updates correctly.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11948].
  {panel}

When a rapid board is based off of a filter query that pulls in issues across multiple projects, the rapid board's appearance is just like rapid boards in JIRA Agile before version 6.6.70.  

This what a board looks like with a single project in the filter query (project = LayOut ORDER BY Rank ASC):
!Screen Shot 2015-04-09 at 6.08.25 PM.png|thumbnail!

Add another project to the filter query (project in (LayOut, SketchUp) ORDER BY Rank ASC) and the board changes to look like this:
!Screen Shot 2015-04-09 at 6.13.05 PM.png|thumbnail!

The expectation is that the board's format would remain that same as in the first screenshot.
fields.summary: Boards configured with filter queries that pull issues from multiple projects do not show the project-centric sidebar

fields.description: As a user, I'd like to have inline editing for custom fields on the Issue Detailed View.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have inline editing for custom fields on the Issue Detailed View

fields.description:
After updating to JIRA Agile 6.6, the rapid board now shows epic links on all cards (feature implemented in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-9451), even when swimlanes are set to "epics". This wastes screen space and distracts from the cards' other content.

Pleas provide a way to hide these Epic links.
fields.summary: Option to hide Epic links on all cards

fields.description:
# Click the Agile link's down-arrow in the top navigation bar, then select your preferred board from the resulting dropdown menu.
# Your board will be displayed. Click *Backlog*.
# Click *VERSIONS* to view the Versions panel, where you can create and edit versions, assign issues to versions via drag-and-drop, and filter by versions.

The ability to add other fields to this view would be beneficial. This is especially true for Custom Fields.
fields.summary: Add other fields to the Backlog Versions Panel

fields.description:
h4. Problem
Any time you create a new user in Agile they have to go through the Getting Started tutorial

h4. Desired behaviour
Be able to disable it for specific groups, such as Developers
fields.summary: Disable Getting Started with JIRA Agile Tutorial for specific groups

fields.description:
As a customer, I think an option to filter issues based on a version customfield in the agile board Plan mode instead of fix version would be very good as a feature..
Fix version is multi select and a system field..we would like a single select version field for planning.
fields.summary: Custom version field instead of the filtering with fixVersion in the Versions Panel

fields.description:
I was delighted to see GHS-9689 implemented, which gives us a nice overview of how much work an assignee faces in an upcoming sprint.
However, the big drawback of this (as has been before) is the lack of Subtasks being shown and/or counted towards a total.

To keep things organized, we'd really like to use Epics to organize our big chunks, split them into Stories of small and defined features (which should, or rather must be finished together to have a working feature) and create Subtasks within them (because they should also automatically end up in the same sprint all the time) that, for example, belong one to a UI developer and one to a backend developer in the end.
Only when both are done, the story can be considered done - pretty much as Epics work right now on a big scale.
But since Subtasks are not shown in the "workload by assignee" view, we're back to square one where we don't actually know how much work someone is facing until the sprint is actually started.
fields.summary: Backlog Specialist Workload does not include Subtasks

fields.description:
When creating a Scrum board, I want to be able to press enter to proceed to the next step of the wizard:

!screenshot-1.png!

This would bring the dialog into line with the ADG and the way the rest of JIRA and Atlassian products work.

It's a small paper cut, but it's bothered me on multiple occasions (this time I decided to raise an issue).

While we're at it, it would be good to make the "Next" button ADG compliant.
fields.summary: As a user I want to press Enter to submit the create board dialog

fields.description:
On the epic panel, if 'All Issues' is selected then we see that the filter takes into account issues from all epics.
And if one Epic is selected it will filter issues based on that particular Epic.

It would be useful if we were able to select more than one Epic, but not the 'All Issues' option, so we could view the issues that are part of those Epics.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to select more than one Epic on the Epic Panel

fields.description:
Hi there,

Our team would love to be able to add attachments to a Sprint (rather than an individual Issue) such as FRDs, design documents and release notes. It would be really helpful for when we close out a Sprint, instead of having to go in and attach these items, which usually cover multiple user stories, to each Issue individually.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Ability to add attachments to a Sprint

fields.description:
To track the relation between time spent and customer value (Story Points) delivered throughout a sprint, it would be useful to have a chart that would combine the time estimate burndown and the value burnup over time. Essentially, it would be the Burndown Chart for time estimates, with an additional line for completed Story Points.

Mockup: !chart.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Combine Time Spent and Value Burnup in a Single Chart

fields.description:
At the moment, logging work against an issue, changes in remaining estimates and removing issues from sprints are reflected in the Burndown Chart in the same way. Hovering over an issue provides more details on the specific change, however, in the overview the difference isn't visible. It would be handy if scope changes and completed work were shown with e.g. a different colour of the line in the chart.

*Use case:* in teams that use burndown charts to communicate status to stakeholders outside of the team, it would make it clear when the team was getting work done, and when it was interrupted and had issues removed from the sprint backlog. It would serve as an early signal when sprint backlogs are frequently subject to change.
fields.summary: Differentiate Between a Scope Change and Completed Work in the Burndown Chart

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have an agile project with a board
# Have multiple statuses mapped on few agile columns (see screenshots below)
!Screen Shot 2015-04-04 at 3.38.32 PM.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2015-04-04 at 3.39.05 PM.png|thumbnail!
# Have a look at the transition labels when moving an issue around
!Screen Shot 2015-04-04 at 3.39.26 PM.png|thumbnail!
# Edit the workflow and change a status name, then publish it
!Screen Shot 2015-04-04 at 3.42.59 PM.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2015-04-04 at 4.05.34 PM.png|thumbnail!
# Visit the board and move an issue around
!Screen Shot 2015-04-04 at 3.43.46 PM.png|thumbnail!

*Expected Results:*
The label 'In Progress' would be 'DEV In Progress' after all the changes.

*Actual Results:*
The label doesn't change even after publishing the new workflow and running a reindex.

*Workaround:*
None at this point.

*Add-on Version:*
JIRA v6.4-OD-16-006
JIRA Agile v6.6.80-D20150309T125253

*Notes:*
Restart won't fix the problem.
fields.summary: Status name won't update on the board once it's changed on workflow

fields.description:
As a user that has large number of columns, the Rapid board becomes quite unreadable. For example refer to the attached screenshot. 

There is requirement for :  
* resizable cards ([mentioned here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5200]), and
* horizontal scroll bar

to make the Rapid boards usable.
fields.summary: Ability to view an Agile board with many columns

fields.description:
When using the 3 column layout, the legend often hides the actual burndown (red) line, making the gadget not very useful. Please provide an option to hide the legend on the Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget. This is important to me as I need to track many sprint teams at the same time.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Please provide option to hide the legend on the Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget

fields.description:
Under the Agile DropDown Menu, the Recent Boards list becomes pretty useless with >9 frequently used boards. 

*To Reproduce*
My first meeting of the day does not show up in the recent list and I have to take the following steps. 

# Click Agile / more...
# Get taken to a screen with the same list that's in the dropdown. 
# Click "All Boards" on the left hand side
# The list on All Boards is paginated, so the page is no longer text searchable, so I have to type the name of the project in the Jira "Find a Board" Searchbox.

Because I attend >9 standups in a day, I repeat this before every meeting because each board will have cycled off the recent list by the time I need it again. I frequently have less than 30 seconds between meetings.


Solutions would be any of the following, in order of preference:

* Have a notion of "favorite boards" with ability to order
* Allow customizing count or membership on recent boards page.
* Make "more..." button show all boards instead of recent boards because clicking more shows you only the boards you just skipped past.
* Make All Boards Page show all boards instead of paginating so that you can use browser text search.
fields.summary: Agile Recent Boards works poorly for many boards in use

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11924].
  {panel}

*Summary:*
The Epic colored label disappear when issue is being re-prioritized. Refreshing the page will make the Epic Colored label to be reappeared. 

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Go to Kanban or Scrum board (Active Sprint view)
# Edit and add any _Epic_ to one of the issues (_Epic Link_ field)
# Move it higher/lower within the same column

*Expected Result:*
- Epic colored label should not disappear

*Current Result:*
- Epic colored label disappear

fields.description:

F( for flagged) isn't in use f.e. ;)

Thanks in advice.

Hello,

i would like to see Colorful Labels like the Epics.
fields.summary: Colorful Labels

fields.description:
Can we have a report showing information like this : 

Epic 1 - original estimates - remaining estimate - total time spent
Epic 2 - original estimates - remaining estimate - total time spent
Epic 3 - original estimates - remaining estimate - total time spent
Epic 4 - original estimates - remaining estimate - total time spent

As a workaround, it can be achieved through a JQL something like this : 
issuekey in (CP-967, CP-1063, CP-1055, CP-968) AND issueFunction in aggregateExpression("Total Estimate for all Issues", "originalEstimate.sum()", "Remaining work", "remainingEstimate.sum()", "Total time spent", "timespent.sum()")
fields.summary: Report showing remaining time, time spent, original time from a list of epics

fields.description:
I want to see the Remaining Estimate and Time Spent on Epic Report.
For now i have set estimation statistic to 'Original Time Estimate' and 'Remaining estimate and time spent', but only shows time spent for closed issues, *not the logged work on in progress issue*.
fields.summary: Epic Report Time Calculation of done work to include logged work of incomplete issues

fields.description:
Please update the documentation [Connecting JIRA to PostgreSQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+PostgreSQL] to clarify that the language based collation is not Supported. For example :
LC_COLLATE = 'sv_SE.UTF-8'
LC_CTYPE = 'sv_SE.UTF-8'


Only ENCODING 'UNICODE' LC_COLLATE 'C' LC_CTYPE 'C'  would work.
fields.summary: Update "Connecting JIRA to PostgreSQL" documentation for collation

fields.description:
JIRA allows to express dependencies between issues by adding links (by default, "depends on"/"blocks"). On the agile boards, these dependencies can only be seeen when selecting a specific issue and scrolling to the linked issues section.

As a developer choosing an issue to work on the Kanban or Scrum boards,
I would like to have these dependencies visualized on the issue cards
so that I can make a more informed choice and have a reduced risk of wasting time by choosing a "not yet workable" issue.

As a product owner ranking issues on the Kanban or Scrum boards,
I also would like to have the dependencies visualized on the issue cards
so that I don't inadvertently rank issues the wrong way around.

The concrete link types to count as "blocking" should ideally be configurable; practically, the standard "depends on" type could also suffice.

Suggestions for this visualization:
* arrows drawn between issues with dependencies,
* icon or a different (darker) card color for issues blocked by other open issues,
* a list of blocking issue numbers (with links) on the cards.
fields.summary: Visualize dependencies between issues on the agile boards

fields.description:
You have change the sprint field all over to be text and not ID except in bulk edit, and now I cant find what Id I need to type in, so I can't bulk change issues to another sprint.

Half way solution, please do it all the way.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit Sprint field should show sprint as text not ID

fields.description:
Having both is superfluous.

!Screen Shot 2014-09-15 at 10.41.20 am.png|thumbnail!

In JIRA 6.4, we could replace one of these with a {{jira/flag}}. But probably a better option is to kill the floating one and "design" a friendlier no-permissions thing. And by "design", I mean make use of [the system-notification pattern|https://design.atlassian.com/2.0/product/patterns/system-notifications/] we have in the ADG.
fields.summary: Double message for report permission fail when not logged in

fields.description: To be able to navigate to different boards while on scrum board. This is useful when there are more than 15 different boards. Therefore, this way it is easier for user to access links and land to desire board.
fields.summary: Links to Navigate to Different Boards in Agile

fields.description:
When I add additional fields to the Backlog view (e.g. "Customer Affected" custom field), any extra fields are shown on a separate line from the default fields (Issue Type, Priority, Name, Version(s), Epic, Avatar, Points). 

This makes backlog management much harder since suddenly I can fit only half as many tasks on the page.  When managing a 500-task backlog and 30-task sprints, losing half my screen real estate is frustrating, especially since my 1920px-wide monitor already has vast unused extra space in the middle of the page. 

Instead, I'd like the option for fields I add to show up on the one-line backlog "card" instead of forcing a 2-line display. 

ideally, I'd like to the backlog "card" layout to be customizable so that I could choose which columns are shown (for example, hide the priority column that we don't use) and where they should be shown. For example, placement options could include: 
* first line - left 
* first line - right
* second line - left
* second line - right

And so on. I'm sure there are other ways to define placement. But this kind of customization is definitely a lower priority than fixing the 2-line thing. The top priority is that JIRA shouldn't require me to give up half my screen real estate to show one more field in my backlog.
fields.summary: As a PM, I want to show extra fields on each backlog task without taking up 2 lines per task

fields.description: If you select an issue in the backlog or active sprint view, then the right panel will open up. This is not useful when you are selecting multiple issues. Selecting multiple should hide this panel and allow the user to make use of their full horizontal real estate in order to see more issue details while they select the issues.
fields.summary: Collapse detail view (right side panel) when multiple issues selected

fields.description:
JIRA Agile: 6.6.51 on JIRA 6.3.12

Using a label to segregate issues between 2 boards based on one project.

1) Created label = 'Calypso' in 3 issues
2) Created label = 'calypso' in 3 issues
3) Set board filter = project = <project> AND labels = Calypso
4) Board correctly display 3 Calypso issues in the backlog
5) Create Epic from link in Epics Panel 
6) The Epics's label are not automatically inherited.

It would be nice if the labels are inherited when creating  Epic from link in Epics Pane.

I also tested with JIRA 6.3.15 & JIRA 6.4
fields.summary: Automatically inherit Labels on the Agile Board when creating Epic from link in Epics Panel

fields.description:
JIRA Agile: 6.6.51 on JIRA 6.3.12

Using a label to segregate issues between 2 boards based on one project.

1) Created label = 'Calypso' in 3 issues
2) Created label = 'calypso' in 3 issues
3) Set board filter = project = <project> AND labels = Calypso
4) Board correctly display 3 Calypso issues in the backlog
5) Create Epic from link in Epics Panel 
6 ) Manually set the labels in the Epic created
7)  Create an Issue in that Epic
7) The issue does not inherit the Label configured in the Epic

It would be nice if the labels are inherited when creating  issue in the Epic

I also tested with JIRA 6.3.15 & JIRA 6.4
fields.summary: Automatically inherit Labels on the Agile Board when creating Issue in Epic

fields.summary: I want to use story points as the column constraint on Kanban board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11878].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

For specific instances there is no link to 'Backlog' or 'Active Sprints' in the new project sidebar.

h3. Workaround

Disabling JIRA Agile and Enabling it again solves this problem.

h3. Cause

This is a temporary issue caused by our deployment of plugins to our production environment.
fields.summary: Backlog and Active Sprints links are missing in JIRA Agile when using the new Project Sidebar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11877].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce :

# Create an issue and add it to a future Sprint.
# Notice that it shows up on the backlog view of the Rapid board
# Now close that issue
# Notice that it disappears from the backlog view
# Now start the Sprint
# Notice that the issue suddenly appears in the Sprint as a closed issue


This is confusing for the users.

{panel:title=*UPDATE 25-09-2018*
|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3399ff|titleBGColor=#3399ff|bgColor=#e0e0e0}

As stated by the Product manager 
{quote}
The expected behaviour should be as follows:

If an issue is closed and is not in an active sprint, it will not be shown in the Backlog (plan mode).
The issues (closed in a future sprint) should not appear in the sprint when it is started.
If is it required that an issue is to be closed in a future sprint then that sprint must be started with the issue included (prior to the issue being closed).
{quote}

This is expected behaviour as the Backlog view is designed to serve as a "backlog" for Issues to be worked on. If an Issue is closed, by Agile methodology, the Issue *should no longer* be worked on and *does not* need to be part of the Backlog as this will conflict with the expected workload.

With that in mind, the actual bug here is that after being closed in a planned Sprint, once the Sprint has started, the closed Issue *shouldn't* re-appear in the Sprint view as the work is completed outside the Sprint and conflicts with the Velocity calculations.

{panel}
fields.summary: Issues closed in future sprints do not show up in the Backlog until the Sprint is started

fields.description:
As an administrator I want to be able to tell users to make a cleanup amongs all agile boards.
The problem is that users tend to create a massive amount of boards for testing purpose and then never delete them.

I suggest that on the 'manage boards' page there is a filter to find all boards you are administrator of. This would make it very easy for users to find what boards they have created or are responsible for to make a decision if it is in use or not.
fields.summary: easy way to find which boards im administrator of

fields.description: The *Agile Wallboard gadget* will get blank and flicker when refreshing the data in the *Presentation mode*. This seems to be the expected behavior, but would be nice if the refresh process happen in a more smoothly way.
fields.summary: Avoid the flicker while refreshing data in the Agile Wallboard gadget when in Presentation mode

fields.description:
Being able to supply a numeric parameter to indicate how many previous sprints to consider would be incredibly useful rather than having to supply a specific sprint identifier. Users could then run queries based on the last 4 sprints or whatever they're interested in which would help would quarterly reporting.

I.e. project = DEMO AND closedSprints(4) means last 4 closed sprints for this particular project. I realize this may be tricky, however, as sprints are tied to a single project.
fields.summary: Supply sprint parameters for closedSprints() function

fields.description: It would be useful to store in the database the creator of the sprints. When we have several different sprints with the same name, it would be a useful information to distinguish those sprints.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to know who is the sprints creator

fields.description: The visual in the planning boards related to how many points each person is assigned would be useful as a dashboard gadget.
fields.summary: Create gadget for team capacity info

fields.description: We have several users that are required to report their the percentage of story points completed vs committed. Please represent this information on the report screens or in a gadget if possible.
fields.summary: Represent committed vs completed for story points as percentage in reports.

fields.description: It would be great if we could add more fields to the issue detailed view, such as the linked Zendesk ticket number, just like it is shown in JIRA.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to add more fields to the issue detailed view

fields.description:
Customer would like to have the time tracking fields (time estimate, time spent and time remaining fields) to be included in the version summary at the versions sidebar in Agile scrum board.

Similar to what we previous have in classic planning board modes.
Please find the example in the documentation below :
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Using+Classic+Planning+Board+Modes#UsingClassicPlanningBoardModes-Version
fields.summary: Add in Time Estimate, time spent and time remaining information in scrum board's version summary panel

fields.description:
h3. *Current Behavior*
There are gadgets that are available for Sprint ( Days Remaining in Sprint gadget and Sprint Health gadget) but there is no gadget available for Rapid Kanban Board/Project 

h3. *Feature Request*
Provide a gadget same as Classic Days Remaining Gadgets for Rapid Kanban Board/Project

{{Original summary "Provide a gadget same as Classic Days Remaining Gadgets for Rapid Kanban Board/Project"}}
fields.summary: Gadget for Days Remaining in Version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11863].
  {panel}

Currently Epic in Agile Backlog only list the summary of the following
* Issues
* Completed
* Unestimated
* Estimate (Original estimate)
* Progress bar

Allowing "Remaining Estimate" to be included in the summary will allow understanding of the current picture of the time that is currently in progress (vs Done in the Progress bar) to be used for planning purpose.
fields.summary: Epic Summary to show Remaining Estimate in Backlog

fields.description:
We are using hosted version of JIRA/Atlassian. I am running a Kanban board. When I update the board name in the config area, it accepts the name, but when I access the board, it titles the board "Kanban Board". In other words it is not picking up the name of the board as defined in the config.

-- Sometimes the proper name is displayed while the board is loading. But then reverts to "Kanban Board" when finished.
-- When other users access the board, some see Kanban Board and others see the proper name for the board.

Thanks.
Ramesh
fields.summary: Board name is not updating

fields.description: Instead of having to edit each board configuration individually, changing Columns or Estimation for a group of boards would be useful
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like the ability to do bulk editing of board configurations

fields.description:
It would be nice to rank the Epics against the other Epics - independant of the Stories that are linked to them. It is a cross-team activity before the different teams start working on their parts of the Epics. So Epics need to be ranked sometimes even before Stories exist. 

 May be the two Screenshots illustrate the problem:

nothing to select in Backlog
!RankingEpics_NewBoard_isEmpty.png|thumbnail!

I can easily set the Rank of Epics in ClassicBoard.
In both cases, the Filter filters for Epics only.
!RankingEpics_ClassicBoard.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Rank Epics againts other Epics

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA Agile, there is currently no method of limiting the type of Issues that can be included in an Epic. This could be useful when focusing on specific areas of the backlog for certain use cases. 

h3. Expected Results
When creating an Epic, have the ability to restrict the linking of specific Issue types. This could be a Checkbox dropdown in the sidebar menu when looking at the backlog.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict the type of issues that are included in an Epic

fields.description:
As a customer I'd like the Sprint Health Gadget to work with closed sprints as well.

Today the gadget works only with active sprints.
Documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Using+the+Sprint+Health+Gadget
fields.summary: Allow Sprint Health Gadget to work with all active and closed sprints

fields.description:
Users start a sprint then set the _Start Date_ and _End Date_. When they complete the sprint before it is actually ended, the _Sprint Report_ will be using the date when they click *Complete Sprint* button. It's causing some confusion for some users as they think JIRA Agile should be using the Sprint *End Date* instead of the date where the Sprint is marked as _Complete_.

By renaming the Sprint *End Date* to *Planned End Date*, I believe it would make it easier for users to understand that the _End Date_ is actually _Planned End Date_, not the actual completion (End/Completed) date for a Sprint.
fields.summary: Rename Sprint "End Date" to "Planned End Date"

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to select which issues belong to a release when you click the release link on the board. 

Sometimes I forget to clear my completed items before marking new issues as completed for the next release cycle. If I could uncheck issues from the release screen I could exclude them and keep those items in the completed list for the next release.
fields.summary: Ability to select which issues belong to a release

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11849].
  {panel}

h3. Summary:
{{*Error rendering 'gh-sprint'. Please contact your JIRA administrators.*}} was thrown for *Sprint* field when viewing the Field Configuration screen.

h5. Step to reproduce
# Go to *Custom Field*
# Refer to *Sprint* field
# Click on *cog* icon > *view*
# The error is thrown like in the screenshot below
!ghsprint.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional Information
* It affects JIRA 6.3.10 with JIRA Agile 6.6.13 and JIRA 6.3.15 and JIRA Agile 6.6.70
* Happens in Clean installation (no changes were made) 
* I think it's related with bug [GHS-11399|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-11399], but in this case, the sprint field *was never UNLOCKED*

h3. Notes
This issue is a *JIRA UI problem* in the Field Configuration only. It indicates that JIRA cannot display the Default Value of the field, it does not affect your boards or prevent issues from being shown. Please continue using the [Troubleshooting guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Issues+are+not+appearing+in+Boards] to find the reason issues are missing.
fields.summary: Error rendering 'gh-sprint' shown for Sprint field

fields.description:
If a quick filter has some invalid field used or tries to reference another filter the user does not have access to, the board will be empty with no error message. For example, the quick filter of {{filter = "Some Other Filter"}} will be accepted when configuring, but when viewed by another user that does not have access to "Some Other Filter", the board will be empty when the quick filter is applied.

Issue also applies to card coloring by JQL. If there is an issue, no cards will be color, but no error will be shown to make it clear there is an issue with the JQL.
fields.summary: Error message is not shown if quick filter can not be run
